intro: Leucanthemum tomentosum, commonly known as the fuzzy oxeye daisy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It features white ray florets surrounded by a yellow disk, with a distinctive fuzzy, woolly texture on its leaves and stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Leucanthemum tomentosum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
